Questions.Question: Who said, 'I haven’t failed. I’ve just found 10,000 ways that won’t work'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote by Thomas Edison reflects his perseverance and determination in the invention process, particularly in developing the electric light bulb.

Questions.Question: Which famous comedian once quipped, 'I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific'?
Questions.Explanation: Lily Tomlin, known for her wit and sarcasm, delivered this humorous line, reflecting on the complexities of identity and ambition.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'Behind every successful man is a woman, behind her is his wife'?
Questions.Explanation: This witty quote by Groucho Marx humorously highlights the often unseen support and influence of women in a man's success.

Questions.Question: Who famously quipped, 'I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote by Groucho Marx satirizes the paradox of exclusivity and self-worth, showcasing his clever and self-deprecating humor.

Questions.Question: Which legendary comedian once said, 'I am free of all prejudice, I hate everyone equally'?
Questions.Explanation: W. C. Fields' satirical humor is evident in this line, humorously challenging conventional notions of impartiality and equality.

Questions.Question: Who quipped, 'I can resist everything except temptation'?
Questions.Explanation: Oscar Wilde's witty remark captures his fondness for paradox and his playfully indulgent nature, reflecting his distinctive literary style.

Questions.Question: Who humorously said, 'I have enough money to last me the rest of my life, unless I buy something'?
Questions.Explanation: Jackie Mason's comedic style is highlighted in this quote, conveying a humorous perspective on wealth and spending habits.

Questions.Question: Which famed comedic actor quipped, 'Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes'?
Questions.Explanation: Jim Carrey's humorous observation humorously portrays the role of women in the lives of successful men, infused with his iconic humor.

Questions.Question: Who humorously said, 'I never forget a face, but in your case, I'll be glad to make an exception'?
Questions.Explanation: This iconic line by Groucho Marx showcases his quick wit and sardonic humor, capturing the essence of his comedic persona.

Questions.Question: Which famous playwright declared, 'There are three things men can do with women: love them, suffer for them, or turn them into literature'?
Questions.Explanation: Stephen Fry's playful yet insightful remark combines wit with literary and romantic implications, reflecting his multifaceted talent.

Questions.Question: Who humorously said, 'I have made an important discovery... that alcohol, taken in sufficient quantities, produces all the effects of intoxication'?
Questions.Explanation: Oscar Wilde's humorous exploration of alcohol's effects balances wit and satire, reflecting his keen observation of human behavior and pleasure.

Questions.Question: Which famous comedian quipped, 'I used to be Snow White, but I drifted'?
Questions.Explanation: Mae West's bold and humorous persona is evident in this line, embodying her playful yet confident attitude towards life and reputation.

Questions.Question: Who humorously said, 'I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early'?
Questions.Explanation: Charles Lamb's wry observation of work ethic and time humorously captures the irony of punctuality through a clever and playful perspective.

Questions.Question: Which famous actress quipped, 'A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction'?
Questions.Explanation: Oscar Wilde's insightful yet jocular comment humorously contrasts the perceived roles of men and women in society, reflecting his multifaceted wit.

Questions.Question: Who humorously said, 'I can't even explain to myself why I am here, let alone the rest of you'?
Questions.Explanation: Charlie Callas' self-deprecating humor shines through in this quote, conveying a light-hearted and humorous perspective on existential quandaries.

Questions.Question: Which brilliant humorist once said, 'I am not young enough to know everything'?
Questions.Explanation: Oscar Wilde's blend of wit and wisdom shines in this quote, humorously acknowledging the limitations of age and knowledge.

Questions.Question: Who humorously quipped, 'I told the doctor I broke my leg in two places. He told me to quit going to those places'?
Questions.Explanation: Henny Youngman's famous one-liner exemplifies his quick wit and comedic timing, capturing the essence of his stand-up comedy persona.

Questions.Question: Who humorously said, 'I don't want to achieve immortality through my work; I want to achieve it through not dying'?
Questions.Explanation: Woody Allen's wry and introspective humor is evident in this quote, reflecting his distinctive comedic style and philosophical musings on life and mortality.

Questions.Question: Which renowned comedian quipped, 'A day without sunshine is like, you know, night'?
Questions.Explanation: Steve Martin's whimsical observation humorously plays with the concept of day and night, reflecting his unique blend of humor and creativity.
